nodes.documentation:
@dev Contract to hold and release in steps the funds of GEO for the presale investors. ERC777 Implementation
 * This contract will be passed a BENEFICIARY (ADDRESS) and a lock DURATION IN DAYS. The constructor will compute
the timestamp at which the funds should be released. Then the beneficiary or the owner can call the unlock function
to release an amount of tokens proportional to the time that has passed since the lock, eg: if a lock of 180 days
has been passed to the constructor, and 10 (10e18) tokens have been assigned, then the user will be able to
withdraw 5 (5e18) tokens approximately. It is important that the amount of tokens being held is divisible by
the duration of the lock in seconds, otherwise the amount will be fully locked until the complete time has passed,
missing the stepped release (ie, if lock duration is 180 days = 15 552 000 seconds, and less than 15 552 000 tokens
are locked, then the division yields 0 tokens per step, and won't be able to unlock the tokens until 15 552 000
seconds have passed).
 * The contract takes advantage of the ERC777 specification in a way that it is not possible to lose tokens.
Sending tokens to the contract will update the locked amount for the beneficiary to withdraw, but it will not
update the timestamp for the full unlock.
nodes.name: GeoTokenLock777

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "GeoTokenLock: You must be the owner or beneficiary"

arguments.value: GeoTokenLock: You must be the owner or beneficiary

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "GeoTokenLock: You must be the owner or beneficiary"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "GeoTokenLock: You are trying to unlock more funds than what you are allowed right now"

arguments.value: GeoTokenLock: You are trying to unlock more funds than what you are allowed right now

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "GeoTokenLock: You are trying to unlock more funds than what you are allowed right now"

nodes.documentation:
@dev ERC777 Hook. It will be called when this contract sends tokens to any address.
This function will update the withdrawn amount by the beneficiary, keeping the internal balance record so that
no more than the allowed amount for the time passed is withdrawn.
Flow should be: this.unlock() calls => token.send() calls => token.tokensToSend(this) calls => this.tokensToSend()
nodes.name: tokensToSend

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Can only receive tokens from the GEO ERC777 contract"

arguments.value: Can only receive tokens from the GEO ERC777 contract

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Can only receive tokens from the GEO ERC777 contract"

nodes.documentation:
@dev ERC777 Hook. It will be called when this contract receives tokens.
This function will update and increase the locked amount for the beneficiary, but it will not
update the lock's timestamp for the funds to be released.
Flow should be: token.send() calls => token.tokensReceived(this) calls => this.tokensReceived()
nodes.name: tokensReceived

nodes.documentation:
@dev Unlock function. Will unlock the requested amount (if allowed).
   * @param withdrawAmount the amount to unlock
nodes.name: unlock

nodes.documentation: @return the token being held.
nodes.name: token

nodes.documentation: @return the beneficiary of the tokens.
nodes.name: beneficiary

nodes.documentation: @return the moment this contract was instantiated
nodes.name: lockTimestamp

nodes.documentation: @return the moment this contract will allow full access to the funds
nodes.name: unlockTimestamp

nodes.documentation: @return how many tokens have been locked in the contract. Not current amount, but sum of all historic locked funds.
nodes.name: lockedAmount

nodes.documentation: @return how many tokens have been locked in the contract. Not current amount, but sum of all historic locked funds.
nodes.name: withdrawnAmount

nodes.documentation: @return how many tokens have been locked in the contract. Not current amount, but sum of all historic locked funds.
nodes.name: computeAllowance

devdoc.details: Contract to hold and release in steps the funds of GEO for the presale investors. ERC777 Implementation * This contract will be passed a BENEFICIARY (ADDRESS) and a lock DURATION IN DAYS. The constructor will compute the timestamp at which the funds should be released. Then the beneficiary or the owner can call the unlock function to release an amount of tokens proportional to the time that has passed since the lock, eg: if a lock of 180 days has been passed to the constructor, and 10 (10e18) tokens have been assigned, then the user will be able to withdraw 5 (5e18) tokens approximately. It is important that the amount of tokens being held is divisible by the duration of the lock in seconds, otherwise the amount will be fully locked until the complete time has passed, missing the stepped release (ie, if lock duration is 180 days = 15 552 000 seconds, and less than 15 552 000 tokens are locked, then the division yields 0 tokens per step, and won't be able to unlock the tokens until 15 552 000 seconds have passed). * The contract takes advantage of the ERC777 specification in a way that it is not possible to lose tokens. Sending tokens to the contract will update the locked amount for the beneficiary to withdraw, but it will not update the timestamp for the full unlock.

computeAllowance().return: how many tokens have been locked in the contract. Not current amount, but sum of all historic locked funds.

constructor.details: note that the duration must be specified in DAYS. This will be translated to EVM timestamp (Unix timestamp) in seconds.

params.beneficiary: address address of the beneficiary of the contract
params.lockTimeInDays: uint256 specifies the period of time from now that the funds will be locked for the user
params.token: IERC777 address of the ERC777 contract

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

lockTimestamp().return: the moment this contract was instantiated

lockedAmount().return: how many tokens have been locked in the contract. Not current amount, but sum of all historic locked funds.

pause().details: Called by the owner, triggers stopped state.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

tokensReceived(address,address,address,u.details: ERC777 Hook. It will be called when this contract receives tokens. This function will update and increase the locked amount for the beneficiary, but it will not update the lock's timestamp for the funds to be released. Flow should be: token.send() calls => token.tokensReceived(this) calls => this.tokensReceived()

tokensToSend(address,address,address,uin.details: ERC777 Hook. It will be called when this contract sends tokens to any address. This function will update the withdrawn amount by the beneficiary, keeping the internal balance record so that no more than the allowed amount for the time passed is withdrawn. Flow should be: this.unlock() calls => token.send() calls => token.tokensToSend(this) calls => this.tokensToSend()

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

unlock(uint256).details: Unlock function. Will unlock the requested amount (if allowed).

unlockTimestamp().return: the moment this contract will allow full access to the funds

unpause().details: Called by the owner, returns to normal state.

withdrawnAmount().return: how many tokens have been locked in the contract. Not current amount, but sum of all historic locked funds.

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.
